sections.heading: The Substance Use Disorder Rate Equity Act is repealed.
sections.text: The Substance Use Disorder Rate Equity Act is repealed.

sections.heading: The Substance Use Disorder Residential and Detox Rate Equity Act is repealed.
sections.text: The Substance Use Disorder Residential and Detox Rate Equity Act is repealed.

sections.heading: The Department of Healthcare and Family Services Law of the Civil Administrative Code of Illinois is amended by repealing Section 2205-31.
sections.text: The Department of Healthcare and Family Services Law of the Civil Administrative Code of Illinois is amended by repealing Section 2205-31.

sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Illinois Caregiver Assistance and Resource Portal Act
sections.text: As used in this Article, "this Act" refers to this Article.

sections.heading: Purpose and intent. The purpose of this Act is to establish a State-created virtual portal that features a virtual comprehensive directory of State, federal, non-profit, and paid resources dedicated to caregiving and Illinois' 1,300,000 unpaid caregivers
sections.text: The mission of this portal is to provide car

sections.heading: Establishment of the Illinois Caregiver Assistance and Resources Portal.
sections.text: Establishment of the Illinois Caregiver Assistance and Resources Portal.

sections.heading: Reporting and evaluation. The Department on Aging, in consultation with the Department of Healthcare and Family Services, the Department of Public Health, and the Department of Veterans' Affairs, shall provide an annual report to the General Assembly and the Governor outlining the usage statistics,
sections.text: Reporting and evaluation. The Department on Aging, in consultation with the Department of Healthcare and Family Services, the Department of Public Health, and the Department of Veterans' Affairs, shall provide an annual report to the General Assembly and the Governor outlining the usage statistics, user feedback, and any necessary improvements to the Portal.

sections.heading: Funding. Funding for the creation, maintenance, and promotion of the Portal shall be appropriated from State funding and can be matched with possible federal resources
sections.text: Funding. Funding for the creation, maintenance, and promotion of the Portal shall be appropriated from State funding and can be matched with possible federal resources.

sections.heading: Implementation date. The essential elements of the Portal shall be listed online in 2025 and shall be fully available by July 1, 2027.
sections.text: Implementation date. The essential elements of the Portal shall be listed online in 2025 and shall be fully available by July 1, 2027.

sections.heading: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
sections.text: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law, except that Sections 3-15, 3-25, 3-27, 3-45, 3-50, and 3-60 and Article 45 take effect July 1, 2024 and Sections 3-7, 3-11, 3-30, 3-55, and 3-57 take effect January 1, 2025
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law, except that Sections 3-15, 3-25, 3-27, 3-45, 3-50, and 3-60 and Article 45 take effect July 1, 2024 and Sections 3-7, 3-11, 3-30, 3-55, and 3-57 take effect January 1, 2025.
